radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the right hand
radiographic_examinations.findings: Soft-tissue swelling along the dorsum of the hand, with extension to the level of the extensor tendons; no subcutaneous air, loculated fluid collection, intramuscular abscess, or destruction of bone.
Prominent soft-tissue swelling, predominantly along the dorsum of the hand; no radiopaque foreign body or subcutaneous air.
Perihilar opacities and blurring of the pulmonary vasculature, consistent with pulmonary edema.
